name: Vessel
description:
“What is it? A vessel, of course, one could also call it a bowl. But what kind of bowl? It is nothing to drink from, and, because of its closeness, it is not very suitable for keeping fruit. Even though one could use it for arranging flowers, like almost every vessel, one would not immediately take it for a vase. Seemingly it is a vessel without any determinate purpose, just a vessel that is just what it is.Though it cannot be recognized as functional, it can be described in its particular shape and material quality. Thus one would discover its perceivable appearance as a character of things prior to all functionality.”
– Günter Figal

Günter Figal is professor of philosophy at University of Freiburg (Germany).
